Package app

Class Album

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.Album
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Album
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class to represent our Albums for each user, where every album holds a collection of Photos.
    Author:
    Eshan Wadhwa and Vishal Patel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addPhoto

        public boolean addPhoto​(Photo p)
        Method to add a photo to our album.
        Parameters:
        p - This is the photo to add to our album.
        Returns:
        Returns false if photo already exists in our album and insertion failed. Returns true otherwise.

      • getPhoto

        public Photo getPhoto​(int index)
        Getter for a specific photo in our album.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the photo to get.
        Returns:
        Returns the desired Photo object at the index, or null if the index is invalid.

      • deletePhoto

        public boolean deletePhoto​(Photo p)
        Method for deleting a specific photo from our album.
        Parameters:
        p - Photo to delete
        Returns:
        Returns true if the photo was found and deleted successfully. Returns false otherwise.

      • updateDates

        public void updateDates()
        Method to update the start and end dates of our album. (Goes through all photos and sets the earliest and newest dates)

      • hasPhoto

        public boolean hasPhoto​(Photo p)
        Method to tell whether a specific photo is in this album or not.
        Parameters:
        p - Photo to check for .
        Returns:
        Returns true if the photo is in this album and returns false otherwise.

      • movePhoto

        public static boolean movePhoto​(Album one,
                                Album two,
                                Photo p)
        Method to move a photo from one album to another
        Parameters:
        one - Host album for the photo.
        two - Destination album for the photo.
        p - Photo to be moved.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the photo was successfully moved. Returns false otherwise.

      • copyPhoto

        public static boolean copyPhoto​(Album one,
                                Album two,
                                Photo p)
        Method to copy a photo from one album to another
        Parameters:
        one - Source album
        two - Destination album
        p - Photo to move
        Returns:
        Returns true if the copy was successful. Returns false otherwise.

      • getBeginDate

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getBeginDate()
        Getter for the begin date.
        Returns:
        Returns the LocalDateTime instance associated with the earliest Photo in this Album. If Album is empty, this is null.

      • setBeginDate

        public void setBeginDate​(java.time.LocalDateTime beginDate)
        Setter for the beginDate.
        Parameters:
        beginDate - This is the LocalDateTime instance we wish to set to our early date for the Album.

      • getEndDate

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getEndDate()
        Getter for the end date.
        Returns:
        Returns the LocalDateTime instance associated with the oldest photo in this Album. If Album is empty, this is null.

      • setEndDate

        public void setEndDate​(java.time.LocalDateTime endDate)
        Setter for the end date.
        Parameters:
        endDate - This is the desired end date LocalDateTime we wish to set for this Album.

      • photoIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Photo> photoIterator()
        Getter for photo iterator.
        Returns:
        Returns an iterator that can iterate through the photos in this album.

      • getPhotos

        public java.util.List<Photo> getPhotos()
        Returns a list of photos in this ALbum.

      • convertEarlyDate

        public java.lang.String convertEarlyDate()
        Method to return the beginDate converted to "mon-dd-year"
        Returns:
        Returns a string that represents the date of the earliest picture in this album.

      • convertEndDate

        public java.lang.String convertEndDate()
        Method to return a string representing the endDate of the album in format "mon-dd-year"
        Returns:
        Returns a string that represents the date of the newest photo in the album.
